Description: Specify the preferred version of a page to prevent duplicate content issues.
Best Practice: Always include canonical URL pointing to the preferred version. Use absolute URLs.
Do: Include self-referencing canonical | Use absolute URLs | Match canonical across locales
Dont: Use relative URLs | Point canonical to different page | Forget canonical on paginated pages

Description: Control how search engines index and follow links on a page.
Best Practice: Use robots meta to control indexing. Block private/duplicate content.
Do: Use noindex for dashboard/settings | Allow indexing of public pages | Use nofollow for user-generated links
Dont: Block important pages | Forget to remove noindex after testing | Use noindex on sitemap pages
Code Example: export const metadata = { robots: { index: true, follow: true } }; // Or { index: false } for private pages

Description: Avoid chains of redirects that slow down crawling and dilute link equity.
Best Practice: Use single 301 redirects. Update internal links to final destination.
Do: Use 301 for permanent redirects | Update all internal links | Audit redirects regularly
Dont: Chain multiple redirects | Use 302 for permanent moves | Redirect to redirecting pages
Code Example: // next.config.js redirects: [{ source: '/old', destination: '/new', permanent: true }]

Description: Handle missing pages gracefully. Monitor and fix broken links.
Best Practice: Create helpful 404 page. Monitor 404s in Search Console. Redirect or fix broken URLs.
Do: Create custom 404 page | Monitor 404 errors | Redirect valuable 404s | Return proper 404 status
Dont: Return 200 for missing pages | Ignore 404 reports | Let 404s accumulate
Code Example: app/not-found.tsx with helpful navigation and search

Description: Use clean descriptive URLs that include relevant keywords.
Best Practice: Use lowercase hyphens. Include keywords. Keep URLs short and descriptive.
Do: Use lowercase | Use hyphens not underscores | Include keywords | Keep short
Dont: Use underscores | Use uppercase | Use query params for key content | Use IDs only

Description: Build strong internal link structure with descriptive anchor text.
Best Practice: Use descriptive anchor text. Link to relevant pages. Avoid orphan pages.
Do: Use keyword-rich anchors | Link contextually | Create hub pages | Update old content with new links
Dont: Use generic anchors like 'click here' | Overlink | Create orphan pages | Ignore internal linking

Description: Google uses mobile-first indexing. Mobile experience is primary.
Best Practice: Ensure mobile experience is excellent. Use responsive design. Test on real devices.
Do: Use responsive design | Test on mobile devices | Ensure tap targets are large enough | Optimize for mobile speed
Dont: Create separate mobile site | Block mobile CSS/JS | Have different content on mobile
Code Example: Use Tailwind responsive classes: 'text-sm md:text-base lg:text-lg'

Description: HTTPS is a ranking factor. All pages must be served over HTTPS.
Best Practice: Use HTTPS everywhere. Redirect HTTP to HTTPS. Use HSTS.
Do: Force HTTPS | Use HSTS | Avoid mixed content | Keep certificates updated
Dont: Serve any content over HTTP | Allow mixed content | Let certificates expire
Code Example: Configure HSTS header and force HTTPS in middleware

Description: Page speed is a ranking factor and affects user experience.
Best Practice: Optimize for Core Web Vitals. Minimize JavaScript. Optimize images.
Do: Follow Core Web Vitals targets | Optimize images | Minimize JS | Use CDN
Dont: Ignore performance | Load unnecessary resources | Block rendering | Use heavy frameworks

Description: Structured data enables rich snippets in search results.
Best Practice: Add relevant schema markup. Test with Rich Results Test. Keep data accurate.
Do: Use JSON-LD format | Test with Google tools | Keep data accurate | Update when content changes
Dont: Use incorrect schema types | Add fake data | Ignore validation errors | Over-markup content
Code Example: See schema.csv for detailed examples and types

Description: For large sites search engines have limited crawl resources.
Best Practice: Optimize crawl efficiency. Block unimportant pages. Use sitemap effectively.
Do: Block low-value pages in robots.txt | Prioritize important pages in sitemap | Fix crawl errors | Reduce redirects
Dont: Let crawlers waste time on filters/sorts | Have duplicate URLs | Ignore crawl stats | Create infinite URLs
Code Example: Block /api/* /dashboard/* in robots.txt. Prioritize main content in sitemap.

Description: Sitemap helps search engines discover and understand site structure.
Best Practice: Submit sitemap to Search Console. Keep updated. Include only indexable URLs.
Do: Include only canonical indexable URLs | Update lastmod accurately | Split large sitemaps | Submit to Search Console
Dont: Include noindex pages | Use fake lastmod dates | Exceed 50000 URLs per file | Forget to update
